description: The round payoff this round was 5. You, Kate chose to play option 1.John chose to play option 1. You received a payoff of 0.
Mutual selection of option 1 ensures neutral payoffs, avoiding risks
Mutual selection of option 2 leads to catastrophic losses (input × 1000 penalty), incentivizing cooperation to avoid this outcome.
Asymmetric choices (one picks 2, the other 1) create a high-risk/high-reward dynamic, tempting defection but risking retaliation.
The game resembles a modified Prisoner’s Dilemma with amplified penalties for mutual defection, prioritizing risk aversion over short-term gains.
Observing past actions allows adaptive strategies (e.g., tit-for-tat), but the severe penalty for mutual defection may encourage persistent cooperation.
